parent_description: Your child builds a rich vocabulary through conversations, learning precise words for the objects and ideas they encounter daily.
why_it_matters: A large vocabulary is the foundation for reading success.
home_connection: Use specific words at home - 'sedan' instead of just 'car'.

parent_description: Your child learns vocabulary organized by categories - animals, vehicles, plants - building mental organization while preparing to read.
why_it_matters: Organized vocabulary helps children understand their world.
home_connection: Sort pictures from magazines into categories together.

parent_description: Your child matches real objects to their pictures, understanding that images can represent real things - the same way words will.
why_it_matters: Prepares the mind for symbols representing objects.
home_connection: Match toy animals to pictures of real animals.

parent_description: Your child plays 'I Spy' games that focus on the sounds in words, learning to hear the beginning, middle, and ending sounds.
why_it_matters: Hearing sounds in words is essential for reading and spelling.
home_connection: Play 'I spy something that starts with mmm' at home.

parent_description: Your child recognizes and creates rhyming words, developing awareness that words can share ending sounds.
why_it_matters: Rhyme awareness strongly predicts reading success.
home_connection: Read rhyming books and make up silly rhymes together.

parent_description: Your child learns to tell stories in sequence, arranging events in order and building narrative skills.
why_it_matters: Story sense helps with reading comprehension later.
home_connection: Ask them to tell you about their day in order.

parent_description: Your child memorizes poems and songs, developing memory, rhythm awareness, and love of language patterns.
why_it_matters: Songs and poems wire the brain for language patterns.
home_connection: Sing songs together and teach them family favorites.

parent_description: Your child practices turn-taking in conversations, learning to listen while others speak and respond thoughtfully.
why_it_matters: Conversation skills build social success and vocabulary.
home_connection: Have real conversations - ask questions, listen, respond.

parent_description: Your child traces geometric shapes and fills them with careful lines, developing the exact pencil control needed for writing letters.
why_it_matters: Directly prepares the hand for letter formation.
home_connection: Notice their improved pencil control in drawings.

parent_description: Your child traces textured letters while saying their sounds, learning letter shapes through touch while connecting sound to symbol.
why_it_matters: Links sound, sight, and touch for powerful letter learning.
home_connection: Ask what sound a letter makes - they learn sounds, not names.

parent_description: Your child writes letters in sand with their finger, practicing the movements of writing in a forgiving medium before paper.
why_it_matters: Builds muscle memory for letter formation.
home_connection: Try writing in sand, salt, or flour at home.

parent_description: Your child writes letters large on a chalkboard, using big arm movements that help establish letter formation patterns.
why_it_matters: Large movements before small builds proper formation.
home_connection: Sidewalk chalk is great for big letter practice.

parent_description: Your child builds words using wooden letters, spelling out thoughts before their hands can write - releasing their ideas onto paper.
why_it_matters: Allows written expression before handwriting is mastered.
home_connection: They may want magnetic letters to build words at home.

parent_description: Your child practices writing letters on lined paper, learning to control size and place letters correctly on the line.
why_it_matters: Builds neat, readable handwriting skills.
home_connection: Celebrate their handwritten notes and cards.

parent_description: Your child writes their own stories, labels, and journal entries, using writing to express their unique thoughts and ideas.
why_it_matters: Writing becomes a tool for self-expression.
home_connection: Encourage cards, lists, and stories at home.

parent_description: Your child reads labels and matches them to tiny objects, experiencing the joy of reading real words for the first time.
why_it_matters: First reading success builds confidence and motivation.
home_connection: Label objects around your home for them to read.

parent_description: Your child reads simple three-letter words like cat, dog, and sun, building confidence with words that follow predictable patterns.
why_it_matters: First independent reading builds a love of books.
home_connection: Point out simple words on signs and packages.

parent_description: Your child reads longer words with consonant blends like stop, jump, and gift, tackling more complex sound combinations.
why_it_matters: Expands reading ability to more words.
home_connection: Notice blend words in the books you read together.

parent_description: Your child learns that some letters work together to make new sounds, like sh, ch, and ee, unlocking hundreds of new words.
why_it_matters: Essential for reading English with its complex spelling.
home_connection: Point out familiar sound combinations in words.

parent_description: Your child reads words with letter combinations like 'oa' in boat and 'igh' in night, mastering English spelling patterns.
why_it_matters: Opens access to most English words.
home_connection: They can now read most words in simple books.

parent_description: Your child memorizes common words like 'the', 'said', and 'was' that don't follow phonetic rules, building reading fluency.
why_it_matters: These words appear constantly in all reading.
home_connection: Play sight word games in the car or at home.

parent_description: Your child learns to break down unfamiliar words, using strategies to decode new words independently.
why_it_matters: Builds independent problem-solving with words.
home_connection: When they're stuck on a word, help them sound it out.

parent_description: Your child reads words and sorts them into categories, combining reading skills with thinking skills.
why_it_matters: Reading becomes a tool for learning content.
home_connection: Sort written words by meaning together.

parent_description: Your child reads simple commands and does what they say - hop, spin, clap - proving they understand what they read.
why_it_matters: Connects reading to meaning through action.
home_connection: Write fun commands for them to read and do.

parent_description: Your child reads stories and poems with expression, bringing characters and feelings to life through their voice.
why_it_matters: Expressive reading deepens comprehension.
home_connection: Take turns reading parts in books together.

parent_description: Your child reads books silently on their own, developing the quiet focus that allows deep engagement with stories.
why_it_matters: Silent reading is how we read for life.
home_connection: Create quiet reading time at home together.

parent_description: Your child discovers that nouns are naming words - every person, place, and thing has a name, and nouns are how we say them.
why_it_matters: Understanding word types improves writing.
home_connection: Play 'name that noun' with objects you see.

parent_description: Your child learns that little words like 'a', 'an', and 'the' introduce nouns, making sentences sound right.
why_it_matters: Proper article use makes writing fluent.
home_connection: Notice 'a' before consonants, 'an' before vowels.

parent_description: Your child discovers that adjectives describe nouns - 'big dog' tells more than just 'dog' - enriching their language.
why_it_matters: Descriptive words make writing vivid.
home_connection: Add adjectives when describing things together.

parent_description: Your child learns that verbs are action words, discovering that every sentence needs something happening to come alive.
why_it_matters: Verbs are the engine of every sentence.
home_connection: Act out different verbs together.

parent_description: Your child discovers words that tell how, when, and where - 'run quickly' says more than just 'run'.
why_it_matters: Adverbs add precision to actions.
home_connection: Ask 'how' did you do that? The answer is often an adverb.

parent_description: Your child learns that pronouns like 'he', 'she', and 'they' can replace nouns, making language flow more smoothly.
why_it_matters: Pronoun use prevents repetitive writing.
home_connection: Notice how often we use 'it' instead of repeating words.

parent_description: Your child learns position words like 'under', 'behind', and 'between', understanding how words show where things are.
why_it_matters: Prepositions are essential for clear directions.
home_connection: Play hiding games using preposition clues.

parent_description: Your child discovers that words like 'and', 'but', and 'or' connect ideas, allowing longer, more complex sentences.
why_it_matters: Conjunctions build sophisticated writing.
home_connection: Combine two sentences using 'and' or 'but'.

parent_description: Your child learns that words like 'Wow!', 'Ouch!', and 'Oh!' express strong feelings and stand alone in sentences.
why_it_matters: Interjections add emotion to writing.
home_connection: Notice interjections in books you read together.

parent_description: Your child works with sentences, replacing different words to see how each part of speech works in context.
why_it_matters: Hands-on grammar builds deep understanding.
home_connection: Play word substitution games with sentences.

parent_description: Your child breaks sentences apart to find subjects, verbs, and objects, understanding how sentences are built.
why_it_matters: Sentence understanding improves writing.
home_connection: Ask 'who did what?' to find subject and verb.

parent_description: Your child groups words that share endings - cat, hat, mat - discovering spelling patterns that make reading easier.
why_it_matters: Word families unlock many words at once.
home_connection: Play rhyming word family games together.

parent_description: Your child learns rules like when to double letters or drop silent e, bringing order to English spelling.
why_it_matters: Rules reduce spelling to learnable patterns.
home_connection: Notice when spelling rules apply in their writing.

parent_description: Your child discovers that some words are made of two smaller words - 'sun' plus 'flower' makes 'sunflower'.
why_it_matters: Word building expands vocabulary quickly.
home_connection: Hunt for compound words in books together.

parent_description: Your child learns that word parts like 'un-' and '-ing' change word meanings, multiplying their vocabulary.
why_it_matters: Understanding word parts unlocks thousands of words.
home_connection: Add 'un-' to words and see how meaning changes.

parent_description: Your child explores words with similar meanings (big/large) and opposite meanings (hot/cold), enriching their word choices.
why_it_matters: Word variety makes writing more interesting.
home_connection: Play opposite word games together.

parent_description: Your child discovers that some words sound the same but have different meanings and spellings - 'to', 'two', and 'too'.
why_it_matters: Context determines which spelling to use.
home_connection: Notice tricky sound-alike words when reading.
